data.title: Revolving Door Roster Updates: Arnold, BMB, Gut & More
data.meta_description: The top new hires and promotions from this week.
data.text:
We’re finishing up the week by celebrating top hires and promotions at the world’s leading agencies.

Above+Beyond

Above+Beyond named Joe Bruce as its new executive creative director. Previously at Wieden+Kennedy, Bruce brings experience running campaigns for the Women’s World Cup, Euros and Berlin marathons and Formula One.

Advertisement

Acadia

Acadia hired Brandon Friedman as its first creative director. Friedman will oversee a team of creatives across bespoke video and photo production, performance creative, campaign creative, graphic design copywriting.

American Advertising Federation

The American Advertising Federation (AAF), has named Jack Bamberger, general manager of agency business for TikTok U.S., and Jacki Kelley, evp chief client officer and chief business officer at IPG, have been appointed board chair and vice chair, respectively, for the coming year.

Arnold

Arnold named Molly Adler as svp, group creative director. Adler will help to lead creative for the PNC Bank and will provide creative leadership at the agency.

Authentic

Authentic hired Sarah Stanley as head of paid media. Stanley brings of 12 years of experience developing and executing innovative paid media strategies spanning digital, social, OOH, print and TV channels.

BMB

BMB appointed Pim Lai as creative director. Lai brings experience collaborating with clients like Netflix, Uber and Samsung on integrated ad campaigns and rebranding projects.

Camron

Camron welcomed Sujata Burman as its new associate director, head of content. Burman will lead brand development both on owned platforms and on clients’ platforms.

Crosby

Crosby promoted three employees to executive vice president. Lee Gatchel was appointed as evp, experience design, Ron Ordansa as evp, creative director and Julia Krahe as evp, senior strategist.

Cut+Run

Cut+Run expanded its roster in Texas. The agency signed editors John McStravick and Adam Henderson for representation.

FutureDeluxe

FutureDeluxe is establishing a footprint in the U.S. with new offices in New York and Los Angeles. The senior management team leading efforts in the U.S. include Ellis Garrod as managing director, New York, Ant Baena as executive creative director, Raj Davsi as creative director and Maria Hanafy as managing director, Los Angeles.

Gut

Gut named Christine Prins as its first global chief communications officer. Prins will lead all global communications work at the agency.

Gut Toronto

Gut Toronto named Max Geraldo as chief creative officer and Amy Badun as head of strategy. The moves strengthen the leadership team and improve creative output and business outcomes.

Havas Media Network North America

Havas Media Network North America made two senior strategic appointments. Adam Rattner was named chief growth officer and Andrea Isaac was named managing partner, business transformation.

InnoVision Marketing Group

InnoVision Marketing Group named Karla Nafarrate as vice president of public relations. Nafarrate brings over ten years of experience leading marketing, public relations and bilingual communications.

Marcus Thomas

Marcus Thomas made two new hires to meet growing client needs. Melissa Hersey joined as vp, project management and Lauren Talarczyk joined as management supervisor.

Outbrain

Outbrain named Greg Archibald as general manager and svp of sales in the U.S. The industry veteran will work to drive revenue growth and expansion for the company in the U.S.

Posterscope

Posterscope named Will Bentley as innovation director. Bentley’s 10 years of experience in creative, visual content will empower the agency’s team to create new, innovative concepts and ideologies.

Premutive

Premutive expanded its leadership team, naming Jay Stevens as chief commercial officer. Stevens will work to scale the advertiser side of the business by connecting agency partners, retail networks and data providers with the publisher side of business.

Station Film

Station Film welcomed director Kevin Bolger to its roster for commercial representation. Bolger is known for his cinematic visuals and storytelling that make for relatable moments, big and small.
